alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Shelby and southeastern Johnson Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Franklin, or 11 miles southwest of Shelbyville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Shelby and southeastern Johnson Counties, including the following locations... Edinburgh. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 80 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
